column4: I added a user to the admin group but the user can't sudo su to root, anyone know why?
sudo is normal.. sometimes you have to have extended root access to install something.. sudo -i will get you to the same place you expected with sudo su.. but correctly.
sudo -i does not work.. I can sudo su to root using the user I used to install ubuntu, how do I duplicate this functionality with a new user?
sorry above my paygrade.. gartral might have the answer
